intro: Tieghemopanax lecardii, commonly known as the Cardboard Tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its unique, fibrous, and woody structure, which resembles cardboard when cut. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it has compound leaves with a feathery appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unusual appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
